questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Dimensionality Reduction in data analysis?

options.A: To reduce the number of variables under consideration.

questions.explanation: Dimensionality Reduction is used to reduce the number of variables under consideration, simplifying models and reducing computation.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common technique used in Dimensionality Reduction?
questions.explanation: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) is a common technique used in Dimensionality Reduction, transforming data into a lower-dimensional space.

questions.question: What is the role of eigenvectors in PCA?

options.A: To represent the directions of maximum variance.

questions.explanation: Eigenvectors represent the directions of maximum variance in PCA, used to transform data into a lower-dimensional space.

questions.question: Which method is used to select the number of components in PCA?
questions.explanation: The Scree Plot is used to select the number of components in PCA, analyzing the variance explained by each component.

questions.question: What is the significance of feature scaling in Dimensionality Reduction?
questions.explanation: Feature scaling ensures components are meaningful, providing accurate transformations in Dimensionality Reduction.

questions.question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of PCA?
questions.explanation: PCA is sensitive to outliers, as they can distort the components and affect the transformation.

questions.question: What is the purpose of using t-SNE in Dimensionality Reduction?

options.A: To visualize high-dimensional data in a lower-dimensional space.
options.D: To store data in a hierarchical structure.

questions.explanation: t-SNE is used to visualize high-dimensional data in a lower-dimensional space, preserving local structures.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common use case for Dimensionality Reduction?
questions.explanation: Dimensionality Reduction is commonly used for data visualization, simplifying complex data for analysis.

questions.question: What is the role of eigenvalues in PCA?
